intro: Comesperma megapteryga, commonly known as the large-winged comesperma, is a species of flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its woody structure, lance-shaped leaves, and clusters of small white flowers. It typically grows in coastal regions and is adapted to sandy soils. The fruit is a woody capsule that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
